headline.main: F.D.A. Review of Diet Pill Relieves Investors

docs.abstract: The regulatory agency released its examination of the safety and effectiveness of Qnexa, in advance of an advisory panel on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Chances for the approval of the first new drug in years to treat obesity seemed to increase Tuesday morning after the Food and Drug Administration released its review of the safety and effectiveness of Vivus's pill, Qnexa.
docs.snippet: The regulatory agency released its examination of the safety and effectiveness of Qnexa, in advance of an advisory panel on Thursday.

headline.main: The Early Word: Looking Toward August

docs.abstract: President Obama meets with top Senate Democrats to game plan legislative priorities for the next few weeks.
docs.lead_paragraph: With the Senate looking more and more likely to pass an overhaul of financial regulations sooner rather than later, President Obama is scheduled to host a group of top Senate Democrats at the White House on Tuesday to discuss next legislative steps.
docs.snippet: President Obama meets with top Senate Democrats to game plan legislative priorities for the next few weeks.

docs.abstract: 6 Q's About the News | How would you choose if you had to pick either teenage smoking or childhood obesity as the number one public health problem to attack as a nation?

headline.print_headline: CHILDHOOD: Obesity in Young Subjects Drops in Study
headline.main: Childhood: Obesity in Young Subjects Drops in Study

docs.lead_paragraph: Sixth graders who participated in a school-based health program were less obese by eighth grade than a group of similar children who did not.
docs.snippet: Sixth graders who participated in a school-based health program were less obese by eighth grade than a group of similar children who did not.

docs.abstract: A federal agency reviews a controversial diabetes drug, menthol cigarettes and diet pills.
docs.lead_paragraph: Highlights of the coming week in health care news include a showdown over a controversial diabetes drug, an early look at a proposed diet pill, more debate over menthol cigarettes and medical records privacy.
docs.snippet: A federal agency reviews a controversial diabetes drug, menthol cigarettes and diet pills.

headline.print_headline: Whether a Child Lights Up, or Chows Down
headline.main: Whether a Child Lights Up, or Chows Down

docs.lead_paragraph: Efforts to fight childhood obesity may have overtaken those to fight teenage smoking.
docs.snippet: Efforts to fight childhood obesity may have overtaken those to fight teenage smoking.

headline.seo: Goal for High School Smoking Is Unmet
headline.print_headline: Goal for High School Smoking Is Unmet
headline.main: Goal for High School Smoking Is Unmet

docs.lead_paragraph: A report calls for a resurgence of antismoking advertising to counter a marketing campaign by the tobacco industry.
docs.snippet: A report calls for a resurgence of antismoking advertising to counter a marketing campaign by the tobacco industry.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Teenage Smoking Rates Spur Calls to Renew Anti-Tobacco Campaigns

docs.abstract: Experts fear the emphasis on tackling the nation's obesity problem has taken away funds and attention from battling smoking habits.
docs.lead_paragraph: The nation has failed to reach its 2010 health goal of reducing high school smoking to 16 percent, federal officials said Thursday in a report calling for a resurgence of antismoking advertising to counter the tobacco industry's $12 billion marketing campaign.
docs.snippet: Experts fear the emphasis on tackling the nation's obesity problem has taken away funds and attention from battling smoking habits.

headline.main: Case Study: Can Honest Tea Say No to Coke?

docs.abstract: In the latest Case Study column, The New York Times's Elizabeth Olson takes a look at Honest Tea, which is searching for ways to maintain its integrity while adjusting to its new relationship with Coca-Cola, a financial backer that has a different way of doing business.
docs.lead_paragraph: From The New York Times's Elizabeth Olson, writing in the Case Study column:
